akas: Transformers Prime: Beast Hunters USA (third season title)
akas from release info: Transformers Prime: Beast Hunters USA (third season title)

1.title: Darkmount, NV
1.plot: The Autobots are on the run after the destruction of their base. Meanwhile, military strikes against the new Decepticon fortress, Darkmount, prove ineffective.

2.title: Scattered
2.plot: Autobots old and new attempt to regroup. Shockwave returns to the Decepticons after years of isolation on Cybertron.

3.title: Prey
3.plot: The Decepticons breed a dragon in the laboratory using prehistoric remains. The dragon attacks the Autobots back on earth. Ultra Magnus finds the group on earth and fights off the dragon.

4.title: Rebellion
4.plot: Ultra Magnus takes control of the Autobots, sending the dragon to the Arctic and fighting Megatron. Meanwhile, as Optimus fades, he struggles to identify a new Prime.

5.title: Project Predacon
5.plot: The Autobots struggle with new team dynamics and Smokescreen begins to regret his decision not to become a Prime. The Decepticons discover Predacon bones on Earth and plan to clone an army.

6.title: Chain of Command
6.plot: Tension builds between Ultra Magnus and Wheeljack as their team faces the return of the Predacon.

7.title: Plus One
7.plot: The Autobots continue to search for Predacon bones. Agent Fowler and June head to a museum to retrieve one, but have an unexpected encounter with Knockout.

8.title: Thirst
8.plot: Mixing Dark Energon with Knock Out's refined Synthetic Energon formula causes Cylas to develop vampiric capabilities, and soon Knock Out and Starscream find themselves in the middle of a vampire-zombie-robot epidemic aboard the Decepticon ship.

9.title: Evolution
9.plot: Predaking reveals a ground-breaking secret, which makes the Decepticons decide to permanently end the Predacon project.

10.title: Minus One
10.plot: Upon discovering that mixing Synthetic Energon and CNA creates cyber-matter, the Decepticons plan to rebuild the Omega Lock. Meanwhile, Soundwave is captured by the Autobots.

11.title: Persuasion
11.plot: Megatron tries to sway Ratchet to work for the Decepticons.

12.title: Synthesis
12.plot: Ratchet agrees to perfect the Synthetic Energon formula, but then begins to sabotage Decepticon plans. Meanwhile, the Autobots use Laserbeak's tracker to find the warship.

13.title: Deadlock
13.plot: The Autobots storm the Nemesis in a final showdown to prevent the Decepticons from using the restored Omega Lock to cyberform Earth.

1.title: Darkness Rising: Part 1
1.plot: The Autobots investigate the return of the Decepticons and must account for a group of young humans who become involved in their eons-old conflict.

2.title: Darkness Rising: Part 2
2.plot: When the Decepticons start experimenting on Cliffjumper's body with the fabled Dark Energon, the Autobots pick up the life signal of their lost comrade. They hurry to the site, where they find a huge Energon mine, under Decepticon control.

3.title: Darkness Rising: Part 3
3.plot: The Decepticons, in order to find the Autobot base, capture and torture Secret Agent Fowler, and it's up to Bulkhead and the three human kids to track him down. Meanwhile, Megatron raises an army of undead Transformers.

4.title: Darkness Rising: Part 4
4.plot: Megatron uses the Dark Energon to summon an army of undead warriors to battle Optimus, while the other Autobots launch a high-stakes rescue operation.

5.title: Darkness Rising: Part 5
5.plot: Through his Space Bridge, Megatron raises the dead Transformers of Cybertron, and summons them to Earth. The Autobots have to find a way to sabotage the Bridge, or else their new home will be destroyed by the legion of undead Decepticons.

6.title: Masters & Students
6.plot: Starscream frees the ancient warrior Skyquake from his tomb, with the hopes of recruiting him and making him his student. But Skyquake has his loyalties elsewhere, and clashes with Optimus Prime and Bumblebee for his own reasons.

7.title: Scrapheap
7.plot: Bumblebee and Ratchet eliminate a swarm of Scraplets.

8.title: Con Job
8.plot: Starscream, still in the command of the Decepticons, intercepts the signal of the Autobot warrior Wheeljack. Kidnapping him, he slips an impostor into the Autobot ranks. The impostor's goal: to locate the enemy base.

9.title: Convoy
9.plot: The Autobots help Agent Fowler escort a dangerous device known as D.N.G.S., but their convoy is soon attacked by the mysterious evil organization M.E.C.H., led by the crazy ex-military Silas.

10.title: Deus Ex Machina
10.plot: The Autobots locate an ancient Energon Harvester in Greece, left there by their very ancestors. But so do the Decepticons who, with the help of Knock Out and Breakdown, manage to steal the device. Meanwhile, Miko has to learn a lesson about the importance of school.

11.title: Speed Metal
11.plot: Jack takes Bumblebee to an underground street race, and encounters among the competition the vainglorious Decepticon racer KnockOut.

12.title: Predatory
12.plot: Arcee and Jack go on a standard recon mission, but have an unexpected encounter with Airachnid.

13.title: Sick Mind
13.plot: When Optimus is infected with an ancient Cybertronian virus, the Autobots must infiltrate the Decepticon warship to find a cure.

14.title: Out of His Head
14.plot: Megatron gains control over Bumblebee's mind in an effort to revive his own comatose body, while Starscream, still preening himself as the Decepticons' supreme overlord, attempts to melt Earth's arctic icecap.

15.title: Shadowzone
15.plot: Jack, Raf and Miko get trapped in-between dimensions, along with the revived body of the fallen Decepticon Skyquake. The Autobots have to figure out a way to save them. The battered and humiliated Starscream meanwhile tries to follow up on his latest scheme to overthrow Megatron.

16.title: Operation: Breakdown
16.plot: M.E.C.H. capture Breakdown to take him apart and implement the gathered knowledge into their secret plans. The Autobots thus have to rescue their own enemy.

17.title: Crisscross
17.plot: M.E.C.H. and Airachnid team up to kidnap Jack's mom, and Arcee has to offer herself as ransom. M.E.C.H. is after the Transformer technology, while the sadistic Airachnid simply wants to kill everyone involved.

18.title: Metal Attraction
18.plot: Bulkhead, Arcee, and Miko clash with Airachnid and Breakdown over a weapon that can manipulate magnetic fields.

19.title: Rock Bottom
19.plot: Arcee, Bulkhead, Jack and Miko are out investigating a seemingly abandoned mining cave. However Megatron picked this very day and cave to execute the traitorous Starscream, and when the two factions clash, it results in a massive cave-in, trapping them under the rocks.

20.title: Partners
20.plot: When Airachnid abandons Starscream on a mission, he takes revenge by offering to join the Autobots.

21.title: T.M.I.
21.plot: Miko accidentally downloads ancient knowledge stored on a data cylinder into Bulkhead's brain. The Autobot gains tremendous amounts of information, but it's threatening to delete his own personality if the data is not removed from his system.

22.title: Stronger, Faster
22.plot: Ratchet, having managed to recreate Synthetic Energon, tests the substance on himself, hoping to gain more power. However the formula is unstable, and his new-found strength causes Racthet to turn into a fierce killing-machine.

23.title: One Shall Fall
23.plot: As an ancient Transformers prophecy is edging close to coming true, Megatron rushes to take matters into his own hands, answering the call of the mysterious Unicron. Thus Optimus Prime finally decides to put an end to Megatron's evil.

24.title: One Shall Rise: Part 1
24.plot: Unicron awakens, threatening to destroy the planet Earth, which is revealed to have formed around his very body in prehistoric times. He rejects Megatron as his servant, and decides to take matters into his own hands to finally fell the last of the Primes, Optimus.

25.title: One Shall Rise: Part 2
25.plot: Megatron joins with the Autobots to journey to the core of the Earth and vanquish Unicron with the Matrix of Leadership.

26.title: One Shall Rise: Part 3
26.plot: The Autobots and Megatron fight their way to Unicron's spark chamber. Meanwhile, Ratchet tells the kids about Cybertron.

1.title: Orion Pax: Part 1
1.plot: After the defeat of Unicron, the Autobots search for Optimus, who has lost his memories and allied with the Decepticons.

2.title: Orion Pax: Part 2
2.plot: The Autobots commandeer the Decepticon space bridge and send Jack to Cybertron to retrieve Optimus's memories from Vector Sigma. Meanwhile, Orion Pax wonders if Megatron is telling the truth.

3.title: Orion Pax: Part 3
3.plot: Jack and Arcee fight an Insecticon and Scraplets on their way to Vector Sigma. Orion Pax begins to uncover Megatron's deception.

4.title: Operation Bumblebee: Part 1
4.plot: While following an Iacon tracking beacon, Bumblebee is ambushed by M.E.C.H. and loses the ability to transform.

5.title: Operation Bumblebee: Part 2
5.plot: The Autobots continue the search for Bumblebee's T-cog. Meanwhile, Starscream and M.E.C.H. team up to create a Transformer.

6.title: Loose Cannons
6.plot: Wheeljack returns to Earth in pursuit of the Decepticon killer Dreadwing. However, his recklessness ends up putting his friend Bulkhead in danger.

7.title: Crossfire
7.plot: Megatron charges Dreadwing and Breakdown with dispatching the traitorous Airachnid. However, things don't go according to plan.

8.title: Nemesis Prime
8.plot: Optimus Prime becomes destructive while M.E.C.H. reveals their master plan.

9.title: Grill
9.plot: Agent Fowler has some explaining to do under the threat of military tribunal and Team Prime's termination.

10.title: Armada
10.plot: Starscream discovers cloning technology just as Airachnid readies her Insecticon army to attack the Decepticon ship and destroy Megatron. Bulkhead, who has no idea how he ended up on the ship, gets unwillingly caught in the middle of this mess.

11.title: Flying Mind
11.plot: In order to get their ship airborne again, the Decepticons inject Dark Energon into its system, but instead of obeying Megatron, the ship develops a mind and agenda of its own.

12.title: Tunnel Vision
12.plot: Arcee, Bumblebee, Jack and Miko head to a New York subway to locate an ancient Autobot relic, but find that the tunnel isn't at all empty.

13.title: Triangulation
13.plot: Optimus Prime travels to the Arctic to find an ancient Transformer relic, but bumps into Megatron's loyal servant Dreadwing and the treacherous buffoon Starscream.

14.title: Triage
14.plot: Ratchet must learn to cooperate with the impulsive Wheeljack to obtain a powerful weapon, which Soundwave and Laserbeak are also after.

15.title: Toxicity
15.plot: Megatron deploys his most vicious Insecticon warrior to stop Bulkhead from finding a new relic, but it turns out that the thing they're after poses a threat to Autobots and Decepticons alike.

16.title: Hurt
16.plot: Miko sneaks aboard Wheeljack's ship to unleash her vengeance on the Insecticon who has nearly killed and seemingly permanently disabled her partner Bulkhead.

17.title: Out of the Past
17.plot: Miko is deeply shaken by Bulkhead's injury, so Arcee decides to cheer up the human girl with story about her past adventures with her former partner Cliffjumper.

18.title: New Recruit
18.plot: A rookie Autobot arrives on Earth, but he seems to be way too eager to fight the Decepticons, much to the annoyance of the other Autobots, especially the crippled Bulkhead, who is unable to go to battle.

19.title: The Human Factor
19.plot: The terrorist Silas, now fused with Transformer machinery, offers to prove himself to Megatron as worthy of being a Decepticon.

20.title: Legacy
20.plot: While Smokescreen becomes accustomed to Earth, the Decepticons detect an Iacon relic--the Star Saber.

21.title: Alpha; Omega
21.plot: Optimus receives a message from Alpha Trion, who tells him that the Omega Keys will revive Cybertron. Meanwhile, Megatron plans to craft a Star Saber for himself.

22.title: Hard Knocks
22.plot: Frustrated by his failure to retrieve and protect the Omega Keys, Smokescreen leaves the base and is captured by Soundwave and Laserbeak. Both the Autobots and Decepticons learn the location of the fourth and final Omega Key.

23.title: Inside Job
23.plot: Smokescreen escapes the Decepticon warship with the Omega Keys by using the Phase Shifter. However, Starscream retaliates with Red Energon.

24.title: Patch
24.plot: Starscream returns to the Decpticons with the Omega Keys. Megatron decides to investigate Starscream's memories to determine his true motives.

25.title: Regeneration
25.plot: The Autobots and Decepticons race to find the Omega Lock which can restore life to their home planet of Cybertron. The Autobots have to use every lethal weapon in their possession to stop Megatron and his troops from reformatting their planet into their evil image.

26.title: Darkest Hour
26.plot: Megatron activates the Omega Lock to revive Cybertron and transform Earth. The Autobots rally in one last stand against the Decepticons on Cybertron.

imdb.title: Transformers Prime
plot: In this new set of adventures the Autobots live on Earth and maintain their secret identity. They are joined by 3 teens as they battle the Decepticons.::Anonymous
synopsis:
TRANSFORMERS PRIME chronicles the triumphant return of the AUTOBOTS via the most cutting-edge computer-generated animation ever seen on television. From Executive Producers Alex Kurtzman & Roberto Orci ('Star Trek,' 'Transformers'
feature films, 'Fringe'), and Jeff Kline ("Jackie Chan Adventures," "Men in Black: The Series"), Transformers: Prime deepens the epic mythology of both the AUTOBOTS and DECEPTICONS, while starting fresh for a new generation of viewers and future fans. OPTIMUS PRIME, BUMBLEBEE, ARCEE, RATCHET, BULKHEAD, and many others are back to "roll out" against MEGATRON's latest attempt to conquer Earth. And MEGATRON proves to be more powerful than ever, having acquired a rare element that allows him mastery over life itself. 'Team Prime' may be few against the DECEPTICON hordes, but they find increased strength via bonds forged with three human teenagers. Make no mistake, TRANSFORMERS PRIME WILL deliver heavy metal action, and nail-biting suspense -- but it also promises to take the human drama to levels as yet unseen by the franchise.
